lead_paragraph: The suspect was captured on Oct. 5, two days before the Obama administration formally accused Moscow of stealing emails from the Democratic National Committee and others.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matt Apuzzo, Adam Goldman and Eric Lichtblau from Washington; Neil MacFarquhar and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow; and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.
byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and HANA de GOEIJ

headline.print_headline: Czechs Arrest Man Wanted by the F.B.I. for Hacking
headline.main: Russian Hacker, Wanted by F.B.I., Is Arrested in Prague, Czechs Say

snippet: The suspect was captured on Oct. 5, two days before the Obama administration formally accused Moscow of stealing emails from the Democratic National Committee and others....
abstract: Police in Czech Republic announce they have arrested man identified as Russian hacker who is suspected of attacking targets in United States; arrest is not announced immediately due to security concerns, but occurs two days before Obama administration formally accused Russian government of stealing and making public emails from individuals and organizations in US.
